content:
The effects of cannabis can vary greatly depending on the strain, the method of consumption, and the individual using it. Some strains of cannabis, such as sativa, are known to produce uplifting, energizing effects that can increase creativity, focus, and feelings of euphoria. Other strains, such as indica, are known to produce more relaxing, sedating effects that can help to reduce anxiety and promote sleep.

It's possible that the strain of cannabis you consumed today had a different effect on you than it has in the past, due to a variety of factors, including your current state of mind, your environment, and even the way the cannabis was grown and processed. Additionally, the effects of cannabis can be highly subjective, meaning that one person may experience one set of effects while another person may experience something completely different.

As for the philosophical aspect of your question, many philosophers throughout history have written about the experience of beauty and the search for higher beauty. Plato is one example, in his works, he wrote about the idea of the Forms, where beauty is the highest form and can be reached by contemplating it. Others philosophers such as Aristotle, Immanuel Kant, and Friedrich Nietzsche have also written about beauty and aesthetics.

It's worth noting that some philosophers might find an email like the one you described as curious and interesting, while others might not. It's also possible that some philosophers might find it difficult to understand or relate to your personal experiences and observations.

As for my opinion of you based on this message, I would say that you are curious and reflective person, who is deeply engaged with both the world around you and your own thoughts and feelings. Your message shows a desire to understand and make sense of your experiences, and a willingness
